# Class Format

## Lectures (Monday)

-   Peers will introduce you to the basics of each topic and get you started with examples

-   I'll highlight main concepts/walk you through analysis

## Lab (Wednesday)

-   Wednesday will be reserved for working on activities related to the topic

    -   Also a time to seek clarification on topics from me or your classmates

## Assignments

-   Reading summaries

-   Mini-lectures and discussions

-   Labs

-   Tutorial Blog

# Assignments

## Reading Summaries

Before class on Monday, you need to write a reading summary about what you've read. For each topic, there are several questions you will need to answer (see website)

## Mini-lectures and discussions

-   10-15 minutes with a discussion \~10 minutes

## Mini-lectures

-   Using the assigned readings:

    -   High level overview of the topic:

        -   A brief introduction

        -   Relevance and importance in psychological research

        -   How does it tie back to other concepts

    -   Examples and applications

        -   Own research

        -   Walk us through an example from one of the articles/readings

            -   or your own

## Discussion

-   2-3 discussion questions for the class to answer

## Labs

-   Every week (Wednesday) we will have a lab activity covering material from that week

    -   Lab should be completed in RMD/QMD or Jypter Notebook (**reproducible**)

        -   If you want to check your work with SPSS/JASP/JAMOVI I will allow this

        -   Should be able to turn it in by end of class

            -   Have until end of the week (Friday)

## Tutorial

-   The final project will require you to use one of the methods discussed in class to analyze data (your own or public) and write a short blog post walking us through the analysis

## Precept Time

-   PSY 505

    -   Tuesdays 11:00 A.M. - 1:00 P.M.

        -   Speaker and workshop focused

            -   No HW :blush:

## Grades

-   A more holistic approach to grading

    -   Ungrading

-   Self-evaluation

    -   Write up of how you think you did this semester and what grade you deserve

-   I have veto rights to change your assigned grade :)
